Text: Re Talk to Joe Sutton on eSpeak Todayby Enron NRON To All Enron Worldwide cc Subject Talk to Joe Sutton on eSpeak Today Log on to ethinkenroncom on Friday November at am Houston time and talk to Joe Sutton on Enrons first eSpeak event What is eSpeak eSpeak is an interactive QA forum on the eThink intranet site where we will be holding scheduled events with a variety of people on a variety of subjects Joe Sutton is our first guest speaker For one hour you have an opportunity to ask Joe how Enron can break down communication barriers Share your ideas with him for innovative ways to communicate and tell him how you want to receive information Also what can Joe personally do to encourage better communication across business units within teams and with your coworkers How to sign up for eSpeak If you havent already signed up on the eThink site you will be required to register before you can participate in an eSpeak event This may take a few minutes so register as early as you can You will be asked to enter your email address and operating company A userid and password will be automatically sent to your email address Use the userid and password to log onto the site An easy way to enter the password into the required field is to copy and paste it from your email You will be immediately prompted to change your password once you are in eThink Each time you participate in eThink forums you will be asked to log on so keep your password simple We want to know what you eThink Your interaction and feedback will have an impact on the development of eSpeak so please send your comments suggestions or ideas to Join the eThink momentum and begin sharing today Log on to ethinkenroncom

Urgently Need Your Response Cc I am compiling two Top Ten Lists to roast Cliff Baxter at his farewell dinner tomorrow evening Top Ten Reasons We HATE To See Cliff Leave and Top Ten Reasons We Are GLAD To See Cliff Leave I need your input ASAP to compile the lists Please respond to this email with anything funny or incriminating about Cliff Thanks for your help Ken

Re Talk to Joe Sutton on eSpeak Todayby Enron NRON To All Enron Worldwide cc Subject Talk to Joe Sutton on eSpeak Today Log on to ethinkenroncom on Friday November at am Houston time and talk to Joe Sutton on Enrons first eSpeak event What is eSpeak eSpeak is an interactive QA forum on the eThink intranet site where we will be holding scheduled events with a variety of people on a variety of subjects Joe Sutton is our first guest speaker For one hour you have an opportunity to ask Joe how Enron can break down communication barriers Share your ideas with him for innovative ways to communicate and tell him how you want to receive information Also what can Joe personally do to encourage better communication across business units within teams and with your coworkers How to sign up for eSpeak If you havent already signed up on the eThink site you will be required to register before you can participate in an eSpeak event This may take a few minutes so register as early as you can You will be asked to enter your email address and operating company A userid and password will be automatically sent to your email address Use the userid and password to log onto the site An easy way to enter the password into the required field is to copy and paste it from your email You will be immediately prompted to change your password once you are in eThink Each time you participate in eThink forums you will be asked to log on so keep your password simple We want to know what you eThink Your interaction and feedback will have an impact on the development of eSpeak so please send your comments suggestions or ideas to Join the eThink momentum and begin sharing today Log on to ethinkenroncom

Africa CustomerBusiness trip February thats our story and were sticking to it Cc time to begin working on planning for the Africa business trip which we are planning for next february I dont think we have a specific date yet but if we can get Terrie Dorothy and Sherri to reserve some dates on our calendars and we can begin inviting customers now and based on the customer feedback zero in on final dates in a month or so I think we should plan on having to people total attend Assuming Enron people and or last minute dropouts we should target inviting to customers My initial cut on these are below Skilling Billy Bob Kriegel Sithe Sam Palmisano IBM Scott McNealy Sun JeanMarie Messier Vivendi John Bryson Socal Edison Others EBS HirkoRice Mark Gilman Blockbuster Don Listwin Cisco Bob Knowling Covad Alternative Alternative ECMFastow Banker Banker Banker Wrobel Asian Guy Asian Guy Asian Guy Lets shoot for the first round of names no later that July so we can have Terrie send out invites Also SherriTerri have we restructured our deal with the guides Ken

Cc Gentlemen I just spoke to Jeff who had just finished his phone call with Dorman ATT Jeff said that Dorman was very interested in our proposal and even had some ideas on expanding the scope of our ideas He said that Dorman would like to get together on Weds June in Washington DC to continue the discussions Im not quite sure what this means except that it appears that Dorman does have a genuine interest in exploring a big deal with EBS So I would recommend that we get together early next week with Jeff and maybe with the Adventis guys and prepare for the meeting Ken

Africa CustomerBusiness trip February thats our story and were sticking to it Cc time to begin working on planning for the Africa business trip which we are planning for next february I dont think we have a specific date yet but if we can get Terrie Dorothy and Sherri to reserve some dates on our calendars and we can begin inviting customers now and based on the customer feedback zero in on final dates in a month or so I think we should plan on having to people total attend Assuming Enron people and or last minute dropouts we should target inviting to customers My initial cut on these are below Skilling Billy Bob Kriegel Sithe Sam Palmisano IBM Scott McNealy Sun JeanMarie Messier Vivendi John Bryson Socal Edison Others EBS HirkoRice Mark Gilman Blockbuster Don Listwin Cisco Bob Knowling Covad Alternative Alternative ECMFastow Banker Banker Banker Wrobel Asian Guy Asian Guy Asian Guy Lets shoot for the first round of names no later that July so we can have Terrie send out invites Also SherriTerri have we restructured our deal with the guides Ken

JeffMark or Sherri or whoever gets your emails Thanks for the Astros tickets The estate planning lawyer that I am using is Don Fizer with Fizer Beck something something He is located in the Galleria at Post Oak Blvd Suite Houston TX and his number is He has been great to work with because I was clueless and he was able to explain this stuff in a way that was pretty easy for me to understand I also recommend making the first stop at the law firm instead of the trust company or financial advisor because I have found several of the trust companies and financial advisors really trying to push cookie cutter stuff and it is pretty easy to get something that doesnt fit your specific needs I found Don very good at looking at my situation and directing me to a couple specific strategies and then to a couple trust companies that are better equipped to handle that The trust company I went with was Sentinel Trust they are located at San Felipe and Kirby Kirby Dr suite Houston Bob Sweeney is my contact there I went with them for two reasons Because I was basically philosophically aligned with their approach conservative and I liked them better and they are very rigorous in their evaluation of investments and they have a guy named Bruce I dont have his last name who is interesting to talk to about markets investments etc and I think he is smarter than the average bear I will get you the name of the other trust company when I can find it Good Luck Ken

Re Talk to Joe Sutton on eSpeak Todaynsf Sent by Enron NRON To All Enron Worldwide cc Subject Talk to Joe Sutton on eSpeak Today Log on to ethinkenroncom on Friday November at am Houston time and talk to Joe Sutton on Enrons first eSpeak event What is eSpeak eSpeak is an interactive QA forum on the eThink intranet site where we will be holding scheduled events with a variety of people on a variety of subjects Joe Sutton is our first guest speaker For one hour you have an opportunity to ask Joe how Enron can break down communication barriers Share your ideas with him for innovative ways to communicate and tell him how you want to receive information Also what can Joe personally do to encourage better communication across business units within teams and with your coworkers How to sign up for eSpeak If you havent already signed up on the eThink site you will be required to register before you can participate in an eSpeak event This may take a few minutes so register as early as you can You will be asked to enter your email address and operating company A userid and password will be automatically sent to your email address Use the userid and password to log onto the site An easy way to enter the password into the required field is to copy and paste it from your email You will be immediately prompted to change your password once you are in eThink Each time you participate in eThink forums you will be asked to log on so keep your password simple We want to know what you eThink Your interaction and feedback will have an impact on the development of eSpeak so please send your comments suggestions or ideas to Join the eThink momentum and begin sharing today Log on to ethinkenroncom

Re Enron North America Corp NYMEX Hedge Exemption ApplicationsI have a commodity futures account that I use to hedge my physical cattle positions If you need more information please let me know Ken Mark NRON Sent by Enron NRON PM To All Enron Houston EveryoneinECTCalgary EveryoneinECTLond on EveryoneinECTPortland EveryoneinECTNew York EveryoneinECTDenver EveryoneinECTOslo EveryoneinECTSingapore EIAustralia Buenos Aires Argentina Office Staff Buenos Aires Argentina TGS Office Staff Enron EveryoneEOGDenver Enron EveryoneEOGCalgary cc Subject Enron North America Corp NYMEX Hedge Exemption Application s We are in the process of preparing applications for position limit exemptio ns for ENAs NYMEX energy commodities futures trading These applications require that ENA represent whether its officers employees owners or agen ts have a power of attorney control or have a financial interest in any other related commodity futures account either individually or acting with another person pursuant to express or implied agreement Please direct any responses to my paralegal Tana Jones via intercompany email or call her at by the end of business Friday June if you have any power of attorney control or have a financial interes t in any commodity futures account other than an ENA or other trading affiliate account IF YOU DO NOT HAVE A COMMODITY FUTURES ACCOUNT YOU DO NOT NEED TO RESPOND TO THIS REQUEST
